intro: Hibiscus microcalycinus, commonly known as the dwarf hibiscus, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, depending on the variety. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Hibiscus microcalycinus is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
